main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified aerial phenomenon in Presque Isle, Maine on March 25, 1951, observed over a duration of 10 minutes by military personnel and civilians.
interesting points: The object was initially believed to be possibly Venus due to its changing color and refraction, but the sighting was ultimately attributed to an unidentified refraction of an astronomical body.
The object was reported as falling and changing color from white to red every six seconds.
Witnesses reported the object to be about 30 feet long, moving fast, and disappearing into the distance, estimated at a speed of 1200 mph and a distance of 3000 feet away.
The sighting involved a range of observations including weather conditions, object appearance, sound, color, and estimated speed and distance.
The witness indicated that similar objects had been seen before, and the sighting was reported to military personnel at Ellington Field and a General in Air Materiel Command.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
